year.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a period of about 365 days or 12 months, measured from any particular time
be 12/21 etc years of age (=be 12/21 etc years old)
year.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I arrived here two years ago.
We’ve known each other for over a year.
It’s almost a year since Sue died.
year.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a period of 365 or 366 days divided into 12 months beginning on January 1st and ending on December 31st
year.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The museum attracts 100,000 visitors a year.
in the early years of the last century
They moved here at the beginning of this year.
year.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a particular level that a student stays at for one year
year.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: a group of year seven students
He was in my year at school.
year.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: a period of 365 or 366 days divided into 12 months beginning on January 1st and ending on December 31st
year.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: this year
She will be eight this year.
next year
I might go to law school next year.
last year
Last year we spent a lot on the house.
every year
They go back to the same resort every year.
the current year
The budget for the current year was £13 million.
the coming year
Here are some events to look out for in the coming year.
the past year
Over the past year everyone has worked extremely hard.
the previous year
They had married the previous year.
the following year
The following year he was made captain of the team.
the new year
The report is due at the beginning of the new year.
the beginning/start of the year
They moved here at the beginning of last year.
the end of the year
Work should finish around the end of the year.
year.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 7:
year.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: ADJECTIVES/NOUN + years
early years
Little is known about his early years.
He remembers the early years of television.
the last/latter/closing years of something
He changed his opinion during the last years of his life.
somebody’s childhood/teenage years
the home in which she spent her childhood years
the war years
She worked for the BBC during the war years.
the boom years
In the boom years, things weren’t too bad.
somebody’s retirement years
He enjoyed his retirement years in Wales.
the Bush/Blair etc years
The rich did very nicely during the Thatcher years.
in recent years
The number of cases has risen dramatically in recent years.
in later years
In later years he regretted their argument.
in years gone by
The old fort defended the island in years gone by.
year.translation[0].note_box[2].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with year
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[0]: Don’t use in with these words
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[1]: They got married in last year
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[2]: I will turn 16 in this year
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[3]: She’s going on a trip to England next year
She’s going on a trip to England in next year
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[4]: We had a lot of rain that year
We had a lot of rain in that year
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[5]: You use a year when saying how many times in a year something happens
I only see my sister about twice a year
I only see my sister about twice in a year
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[6]: You use  in the year when saying the year when something happens
In the year 2050 sea levels could be much higher
The record was a hit in the year that I was born
year.translation[0].note_box[2].items[7]: You use all year when talking about something that happens during every part of a year
There is enough snow here to ski all year
There is enough snow here to ski all the year
year.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the period of time beginning on January 1 and ending on December 31
year.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The Small Business Administration arranged 55,000 small business loans last year.
year.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: any period of time equal to about 12 months
year.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: My passport expires in a year.
